alert.note: Alert for Coastal Nassau (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 8:52AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Nassau and southeastern Camden Counties through 930 AM EDT... At 852 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspout over the Atlantic Ocean 7 miles east of Little Talbot Island, or 15 miles northeast of Ponte Vedra Beach, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts and wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... St. Marys, Fernandina Beach, Kings Bay Base, Talbot Island, Amelia City, High Point, Dungeness, Cumberland Island and Harrietts Bluff. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
